titleInfo.title: The University magazine: conducted by the senior class of East Tennessee University, 1841 November - 1842 July

mods.abstract: This publication contains issues of the Tennessee University student magazine from 1841 to 1842. It is a literary magazine containing works by students, and is managed for the student body by representative from the senior class. This volume includes the following after the magazine issues: The Israelites in Egypt, a drama; A system of punctuation for students by the East Tennessee University, April 1840; an address delivered before the Chi-Delta Society of East Tennessee University, 1841 August 3 by Alexander Anderson; an oration delivered before the Chi Delta Society of East Tennessee University, 1840 February 22 by A. M. Rosborough; a discourse delivered before the senior class of the University of East Tennessee, 1841 by Reverend William Mack; an East Tennessee College commencement address by Joseph Estabrook, president of the College, 1838 September 12; a commencement exercises program for East Tennessee University, 1840 August 5; a catalog of the officers and students of East Tennessee University, 1841; a catalog of the officers and students of East Tennessee University, 1842; a catalog of the officers and students of East Tennessee University, 1843; a commencement exercises program for East Tennessee University, 1841 August 4; an anniversary program for the Chi Delta and Philomathesian societies at East Tennessee University, 1841 March 5; an anniversary program for the Chi Delta and Philomathesian societies at East Tennessee University, 1842 March 4.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
